River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Vincent Ward is the complete lack of subtitles for the Maori dialect even when non-Maori characters are speaking to each other.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. If you look carefully every time he is disgusted, annoyed, or stressed you can see his finger tips go white. His wife had gastric bypass and hysterectomy surgery in season 1 so what was left of his hair probably fell out then. That would

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..
